definition: To have faith in someone or something, relying on their reliability, integrity, and trustworthiness. It is commonly used to describe the act of placing confidence in another person, often in personal relationships, professional settings, or when sharing sensitive information.

examples.german: Sie hat kein Vertrauen in ihn.
examples.english: She has no trust in him.

examples.german: Das Vertrauen zwischen ihnen ist zerbrochen.
examples.english: The trust between them is broken.
